Create various visualization of the LFQdata

Source: R/LFQData.R
LFQDataPlotter.Rd

Create various visualization of the LFQdata

Create various visualization of the LFQdata

See also

Other LFQData: LFQDataStats, LFQDataSummariser, LFQData

Public fields

lfq

LFQData object

prefix

prefix to figure names when writing, e.g. protein_

file_paths_pdf

with paths to figures

file_paths_html

with paths to figures

Method new()

create LFQDataPlotter

Usage

LFQDataPlotter$new(lfqdata, prefix = "ms_")

Arguments

lfqdata

LFQData

prefix

will be prepended to outputs written

Method heatmap()

heatmap of intensities

Usage

LFQDataPlotter$heatmap(na_fraction = 0.3)

Arguments

na_fraction

max fraction of NA's per row

Returns

pheatmap

Method heatmap_cor()

heatmap of sample correlations

Usage

LFQDataPlotter$heatmap_cor()

Returns

pheatmap

Method pca()

pca plot

Usage

LFQDataPlotter$pca()

Returns

ggplot

Method pca_plotly()

pca plot

Usage

LFQDataPlotter$pca_plotly()

Returns

plotly

Method boxplots()

boxplots for all proteins

Usage

LFQDataPlotter$boxplots()

Returns

tibble with column boxplots containing ggplot objects

Method missigness_histogram()

histogram of intensities given number of missing in conditions

Usage

LFQDataPlotter$missigness_histogram()

Returns

ggplot

Method missingness_per_condition()

barplot with number of features with 1,2, etc missing in condition

Usage

LFQDataPlotter$missingness_per_condition()

Returns

ggplot

Method missingness_per_condition_cumsum()

barplot with cumulative sum of features with 1,2, etc missing in condition

Usage

LFQDataPlotter$missingness_per_condition_cumsum()

Returns

ggplot

Method NA_heatmap()

heatmap of features with missing values

Usage

LFQDataPlotter$NA_heatmap()

Returns

ggplot

Method intensity_distribution_density()

density distribution of intensities

Usage

LFQDataPlotter$intensity_distribution_density()

Returns

ggplot

Method intensity_distribution_violin()

Violinplot showing distribution of intensities in all samples

Usage

LFQDataPlotter$intensity_distribution_violin()

Returns

ggplot

Method pairs_smooth()

pairsplot of intensities

Usage

LFQDataPlotter$pairs_smooth(max = 10)

Arguments

max

maximal number of samples to show

Returns

NULL

plot of sample correlations

Usage

LFQDataPlotter$sample_correlation()

Returns

NULL

Method write_boxplots()

Usage

LFQDataPlotter$write_boxplots(path_qc, width = 6, height = 6)

Arguments

path_qc

path to write to

width

fig width

height

fig height

Method write_pltly()

write pltly figures to path_qc

Usage

LFQDataPlotter$write_pltly(fig, path_qc, fig_name)

Arguments

fig

pltly figure

path_qc

path to write to

fig_name

file name (without extension)

Returns

path the file was written to.

Method write_pdf()

write figure to pdf

Usage

LFQDataPlotter$write_pdf(fig, path_qc, fig_name, width = 7, height = 7)

Arguments

fig

ggplot or pheatmap

path_qc

path to write to

fig_name

name of figure (no extension)

width

figure width

height

figure height

Returns

path the file was written to

Method write()

write heatmaps and pca plots to files

Usage

LFQDataPlotter$write(path_qc)

Arguments

path_qc

path to write to

Method clone()

The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

Usage

LFQDataPlotter$clone(deep = FALSE)

Arguments

deep

Whether to make a deep clone.

Examples


library(prolfqua)
istar <- prolfqua::dataIonstarProtein_subsetNorm

istar$data <- istar$data %>% dplyr::filter(protein_Id %in% sample(protein_Id, 100))

lfqdata <- LFQData$new(
 istar$data,
 istar$config)
#LFQDataPlotter$debug("pca_plotly")
lfqplotter <- lfqdata$get_Plotter()
graphics.off()
lfqplotter$heatmap()
graphics.off()
lfqplotter$heatmap_cor()
graphics.off()
lfqplotter$pca()

#> Joining, by = "sampleName"
lfqplotter$pca_plotly()

#> Joining, by = "sampleName"

#tmp <- lfqplotter$boxplots()
#tmp$boxplot[[1]]
lfqplotter$missigness_histogram()

#> completing cases
#> isotope ~ dilution.
#> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.
lfqplotter$missingness_per_condition()

#> completing cases
lfqplotter$missingness_per_condition_cumsum()

#> completing cases
#> isotope ~ dilution.

lfqplotter$NA_heatmap()

#> rows with NA's: 17; all rows :82
lfqplotter$intensity_distribution_density()

#> Warning: Removed 72 rows containing non-finite values (stat_density).
lfqplotter$intensity_distribution_violin()

#> Warning: Removed 72 rows containing non-finite values (stat_ydensity).
lfqplotter$pairs_smooth()

#> NULL
lfqplotter$sample_correlation()
prolfqua::plot_sample_correlation(istar$data, istar$config)
